N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 333.3 - Procedure for filing application for designation as preferred source

State Regulations
(a) The nonprofit
agency or commission, designated by either the Commissioner of Social Services
or the Commissioner of Education, must submit an application for its
preferential designation to the Office of General Services at least 30 days
prior to the date the service is to start. Included in the application must be: (1)
the complete name, address and telephone
number of the handicapped organization which will perform the service, and the
date the organization is capable of commencing the required work; (2)
the complete name and address of the
using agency and the name and telephone number of the purchasing
agent; (3)
a complete up-to-date
copy of the job specifications; (4)
where a contract is governed by a prevailing wage rate, as established by the

Department of Labor, that prevailing wage schedule must be submitted with the
job specifications. If a reduction in the prevailing wage rate is used to
determine the cost of services, a written statement from the Department of

Labor authorizing the reduction must be included in the proposal; (5)
where the contract is not governed by the
prevailing wage law, but is governed by the minimum wage law and a dilution or
reduction of the minimum wage is made in computing labor costs, a written
statement must accompany the proposal citing legal authority for such dilution
or reduction; and
(6)
a
certification that the actual composition of the work force on each individual
service contract meets the same standards used by the Commissioners of

Education and Social Services in certifying the organization. (b) The Office of General Services
will review applications for preferred designation, taking into account
reasonable costs of labor, materials and overhead necessarily incurred by the
agencies for the blind or other severely handicapped under efficient methods of
procurement, production, performance and administration. After this review, the
applicable nonprofit agency or commission and the prospective using agency
shall be notified in writing of the determination. (c) No request for price approval will be
considered by the Office of General Services if such request is received after
a public bid opening was held by a using agency. All information required of
any bidder, including but not limited to prices, shall be submitted by the
agency or commission representing the handicapped agencies to OGS prior to any
formal bid opening to be held by the using agency. Notes
